input: Imagine a self-contained, hypothetical world with only the following conditions, and without any unmentioned factors or causal relationships: Liking spicy food has a direct effect on room. The candle has a direct effect on room. The overall probability of liking spicy food is 43%. The probability of not liking spicy food and dark room is 22%. The probability of liking spicy food and dark room is 31%. Is the chance of dark room smaller when observing liking spicy food?
